comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The Palácio Foz in Lisbon Streetview: maps.google.com/maps?q=38.715849,-9.141628&ll=38.7154...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "The neo-classical Palácio Foz was designed by the Italian architect Francisco Xavier Fabri and built shortly after the great earthquake in 1755, for the Marquês de Castelo Melhor. It was purchased by the Marquês de Foz in 1886 when it received the first of many facelifts. It now houses, amongst other things, one of Lisbon’s Tourist Information centres and an art gallery. It is magnificently decorated internally and the ballroom features outstanding paintings by Columbano Bordalo Pinheiro (1857-1929), one of the leading painters of his generation and a master of realism in Portugal." www.aportugalattraction.com/portugal-attractions/palcio-f...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: www.gmcs.pt/palaciofoz/download/pt/palacio-foz.pdf, page 59 says that "in 1904, it became the quarters of the North-American legation, which stayed there for an unknown period of time." The North-American Legation quarters were on the 1st floor of the Palace (page 47f).

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks B-59 for the additional information. We will add Palácio Foz to the catalog record.
